metadata.dc:description: OBJECTIVE To determine the prevalence of metabolic syndrome (MS) and its risk factors in patients with Acute Ischemic Coronary Syndrome (AICS) in a tertiary hospital. METHODS A total of 65 patients admitted to Cardiac Intensive Care Unit with myocardial infarction or unstable angina participated. MS was diagnosed in accordance to the Adult Treatment Panel III (ATPIII) criteria. RESULTS The total prevalence of MS was 84.6% (95% CI: 75.6 to 93.6). MS was more frequent in women, persons with obesity according to the body mass index (BMI), family background diabetes, and dyslipidemia. Phenotype predictors of MS were: BMI (OR=2.12, 95% CI: 1.24, 3.17) and familiar history of dyslipidemia (OR=0.026, 95% CI: 0.003, 0.587). CONCLUSIONS The prevalence of MS with AICS is higher than that reported in other populations. This fact is alarming if this risk is maintained in the Mexican population.
metadata.dc:title: Identificación de componentes del síndrome metabólico en pacientes mexicanos hospitalizados por síndrome isquémico coronario agudo: una herramienta para la prevención.
[Identification of components of metabolic syndrome in Mexican patients hospitalized for acute ischemic coronary syndrome: a tool for prevention].
